DataElement.preferredName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Area that Hurts Most Diagram Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of where pain is felt the most, using a diagram.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire Area that Hurts Most Diagram
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale._Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI Short Form) On the diagram, put an X on the area that hurts the most._A drawing intended to explain how something works; a drawing showing the relation between the parts.

Concepts.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized survey originally developed and copyrighted by Charles S. Cleeland in 1991 which is used to evaluate the severity of a patient's pain and the impact that their pain has on their daily activities. This shorter version of the Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) is more useful for clinical trials, can be completed by the patient or in an interview format, and consists of only 9 questions most of which can be answered on a 0-10 rating scale.
